questions.text: A man fell from 35 feet height . Eyewitnesses say that he landed directly on his feet. Which of the following injuries will confirm this fact?

options.label: A
options.text: Ring fracture of foramen magnum+ Lumbar spine injury

options.label: B
options.text: Pond fracture skull + cervical spine injury

options.label: C
options.text: Gutter fracture skull + cervical spine injury

options.label: D
options.text: Depressed fracture skull + cervical spine injury

questions.correct_answer: A. Ring fracture of foramen magnum+ Lumbar spine injury

questions.text: A bomb blast took place in delhi following which two persons died . All of the following are true about these types of injuries except

options.label: B
options.text: Force of explosion is mostlly directional

options.label: D
options.text: Bruise, laceration and abrasions are triad of main injuries seen

questions.correct_answer: B. Force of explosion is mostlly directional

A person was advised by his orthopedician to get regular dressing of his wound done. But the patient did not give care. The patient visited after sometime at which time the orthopedician again advised regular dressing but did not do the dressing himself as he said he was busy. Finally the wound enlarged and the underlying bone developed osteomyelitis. Which statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The doctor is not guilty because of contributory negligence.

options.label: B
options.text: Doctor is guilty under last clear chance doctrine.

options.label: C
options.text: Doctor is guilty under avoidable circumstances.

options.label: D
options.text: Doctoris is guilty as he perscribed wrong medicines.

questions.correct_answer: A. The doctor is not guilty because of contributory negligence.

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct regarding teeth features and ethnicity?

A teenage girl was found dead in her room. On post-mortem examination the following appearances were found. Image A shows the appearance of neck on external examination. A 14-years-old rape victim was brought to the hospital with 22 weeks of pregnancy. All of the following are correct statements regarding the case, except:

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal swab need not be taken

options.label: B
options.text: The fetus can be aborted after her consent

options.label: C
options.text: Examination can be done by a male doctor with a female attendant

options.label: D
options.text: Urine pregnancy test is not necessary

questions.correct_answer: A. Vaginal swab need not be taken
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Option C is obvious.
  • • • Urine pregnancy test is not necessary.
  • • • Fetus can be terminated, as it is after 22 weeks of pregnancy.
